Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Three-dimensional network with channels; monoclinic cell P21/c; formed by Co3+-based metalloligands connected through secondary Zn2+ ions.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size compatibility allowing access to interior catalytic sites.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 2 mol % catalyst; room temperature; no solvent for cyanation reactions.
Other Information.Additional Info: Resulted in good to excellent yields (e.g., 98% yield) for cyanation reaction, indicating uncluttered access to catalytic sites.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size compatibility allowing access to interior catalytic sites.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size compatibility allowing access to interior catalytic sites.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 2 mol % catalyst; room temperature; no solvent for cyanation reactions.
Other Information.Additional Info: Resulted in good to excellent yields (e.g., 95% yield) for cyanation reaction, indicating uncluttered access to catalytic sites.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion; bulkier molecules are excluded from interior catalytic sites due to dense packing of the MOF.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 2 mol % catalyst; room temperature; no solvent for cyanation reactions.
Other Information.Additional Info: Comparatively lower yield (e.g., 58% yield) due to exclusion from internal catalytic sites, with catalysis occurring primarily on the surface.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion; bulkier molecules are excluded from interior catalytic sites due to dense packing of the MOF.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 2 mol % catalyst; room temperature; no solvent for cyanation reactions.
Other Information.Additional Info: Comparatively lower yield (e.g., 65% yield) due to exclusion from internal catalytic sites, with catalysis occurring primarily on the surface.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion; bulkier molecules are excluded from interior catalytic sites due to dense packing of the MOF.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 2 mol % catalyst; room temperature; no solvent for cyanation reactions.
Other Information.Additional Info: Comparatively lower yield (e.g., 55% yield) due to exclusion from internal catalytic sites, with catalysis occurring primarily on the surface.

Experimental Validation.Method: Catalytic conversion comparison of different sized substrates using cyanation reactions, quantified by GC/GC-MS; structural integrity confirmed by PXRD and SEM.
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Differential catalytic yield (55-99%) with smaller aldehydes yielding high conversion and bulkier aldehydes showing reduced conversion (e.g., 1-naphthaldehyde yield 55-65%).

Other Information.Additional Info: Catalyst reusability demonstrated for 5 cycles with intact structural integrity. Functions as a heterogeneous catalyst. Contains Lewis acidic Zn(II) sites. Characterized by 29% solvent-accessible voids.

Experimental Validation.Method: Catalytic conversion comparison of different sized substrates using cyanation reactions, quantified by GC/GC-MS; structural integrity confirmed by PXRD and SEM.
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: High catalytic yield for all tested aldehydes (95-99% for smaller aldehydes, 85-92% for bulkier aldehydes), indicating better accessibility.

Other Information.Additional Info: Catalyst reusability demonstrated for 5 cycles with intact structural integrity. Functions as a heterogeneous catalyst. Contains Lewis acidic Zn(II) sites. Characterized by 19.3% solvent-accessible voids.
